description.para: Methods that initialize and return the shared JREngage instance

memberdef.argsstring: (final Context context, final String appId, final String tokenUrl, final JREngageDelegate delegate)
memberdef.name: initInstance

detaileddescription.para: Initializes and returns the singleton instance of JREngage.

parameterdescription.para: The Android Context used to access to system resources (e.g. global preferences). This value cannot be null
Your 20-character application ID. You can find this on your application's Engage Dashboard at http://rpxnow.com. This value cannot be null

The URL on your server where you wish to complete authentication, or null. If provided, the JREngage library will post the user's authentication token to this URL where it can used for further authentication and processing. When complete, the library will pass the server's response back to the your application
The delegate object that implements the JREngageDelegate interface

simplesect.para: The shared instance of the JREngage object initialized with the given appId, tokenUrl, and delegate. If the given appId is null, returns null

detaileddescription.para: Returns the singleton instance, provided it has been initialized.

simplesect.para: The JREngage instance if properly initialized, null otherwise

description.para: Methods that manage authenticated users remembered by the library

detaileddescription.para: Remove the user's credentials for the given provider from the library.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the provider on which the user authenticated. For a list of possible strings, please see the List of Providers

detaileddescription.para: Remove the user's credentials for all providers from the library.
Specify whether the Engage for Android library will require the user to reauthenticate. Reauthentication will require the user to re-enter their password.

parameterdescription.para: true if the library should force reauthentication for all providers or false if the library should allow cached credentials to authenticate the user

description.para: Methods to cancel authentication and social publishing

detaileddescription.para: Stops the authentication flow. This finishes all Engage for Android activities and returns the calling Activity to the top of the application's activity stack.
Stops the publishing flow. This finishes all Engage for Android activities and returns the calling Activity to the top of the application's activity stack.
Specify a token URL (potentially a different token URL than the one the library was initialized with).

parameterdescription.para: The new token URL you wish authentications to post the Engage auth_info token to

description.para: Add/remove delegates that implement the JREngageDelegate interface

detaileddescription.para: Add a JREngageDelegate to the library.

parameterdescription.para: The object that implements the JREngageDelegate interface

detaileddescription.para: Remove a JREngageDelegate from the library.

parameterdescription.para: The object that implements the JREngageDelegate interface

description.para: Methods that display the Engage for Android dialogs which initiate authentication and social publishing

memberdef.argsstring: (final Activity fromActivity, final String providerName, final Class<?extends JRCustomInterface > uiCustomization)
memberdef.name: showDirectProviderFlowInternal

detaileddescription.para: Start a new Android Activity and take the user through the sign-in process.

parameterdescription.para: The Activity from which to show the authentication dialog

detaileddescription.para: Start a new Android Activity and take the user through the sign-in process.

fromActivity
The Activity from which to show the authentication dialog
uiCustomization
A Class reference to a subclass of JRCustomInterfaceConfiguration or JRCustomInterfaceView
If the reference is to a JRCustomView subclass then the an instance of that custom view will be displayed as the header of the list of providers the user is presented with. This header is the usual place to include custom username/password authentication UI.
If the reference is to a JRCustomInterfaceConfiguration subclass then all of the customizations specified by an instance of that subclass will be applied.

xrefdescription.para: use showAuthenticationDialog(Activity fromActivity, boolean skipReturningUserLandingPage) instead.

parameterdescription.para: See showAuthenticationDialog(Activity fromActivity, boolean skipReturningUserLandingPage)

detaileddescription.para: Begins authentication. The library will start a new Android Activity and take the user through the sign-in process.

parameterdescription.para: The Activity from which to show the authentication dialog

Prevents the dialog from opening to the returning-user landing page when true. That is, the dialog will always open straight to the list of providers. The dialog falls back to the default behavior when false

simplesect.para: If you always want to force the user to re-enter his/her credentials, pass true to the method setAlwaysForceReauthentication().

xrefdescription.para: use showAuthenticationDialog(Activity fromActivity, String provider) instead

parameterdescription.para: See showAuthenticationDialog(Activity fromActivity, String provider)

detaileddescription.para: Begins authentication. The library will start a new Android Activity and take the user through the sign-in process.

parameterdescription.para: The Activity from which to show the authentication dialog

Specify a provider to start authentication with. No provider selection list will be shown, the user will be brought directly to authentication with this provider. If null the user will be shown the provider list as usual.

simplesect.para: If you always want to force the user to re-enter his/her credentials, pass true to the method setAlwaysForceReauthentication().

xrefdescription.para: use showAuthenticationDialog(Activity fromActivity, String provider) instead

parameterdescription.para: See showAuthenticationDialog(Activity fromActivity, String provider)
See showAuthenticationDialog(Activity fromActivity, String provider)

detaileddescription.para: Begins authentication. The library will start a new Android Activity and take the user through the sign-in process.

parameterdescription.para: The Activity from which to show the authentication dialog

Prevents the dialog from opening to the returning-user landing page when true. That is, the dialog will always open straight to the list of providers. The dialog falls back to the default behavior when false

Specify a provider to start authentication with. No provider selection list will be shown, the user will be brought directly to authentication with this provider. If null the user will be shown the provider list as usual.

simplesect.para: If you always want to force the user to re-enter his/her credentials, pass true to the method setAlwaysForceReauthentication().

xrefdescription.para: use showAuthenticationDialog(Activity fromActivity, Boolean skipReturningUserLandingPage, String provider, Class<? extends JRCustomInterface> uiCustomiztion) instead.

See the undeprecated method
See the undeprecated method

memberdef.argsstring: (final Activity fromActivity, final Boolean skipReturningUserLandingPage, final String provider, final Class<?extends JRCustomInterface > uiCustomization)
memberdef.name: showAuthenticationDialog

detaileddescription.para: Begins authentication. The library will start a new Android Activity and take the user through the sign-in process.

parameterdescription.para: The Activity from which to show the authentication dialog

Prevents the dialog from opening to the returning-user landing page when true. That is, the dialog will always open straight to the list of providers. The dialog falls back to the default behavior when false

Specify a provider to start authentication with. No provider selection list will be shown, the user will be brought directly to authentication with this provider. If null the user will be shown the provider list as usual.
The custom sign-in object to display in the provider list. May be null for no custom sign-in.

simplesect.para: If you always want to force the user to re-enter his/her credentials, pass true to the method setAlwaysForceReauthentication().

xrefdescription.para: use showSocialPublishingDialog(Activity fromActivity, JRActivityObject activity) instead

parameterdescription.para: See the undeprecated method

detaileddescription.para: Begin social publishing. The library will start a new Android Activity enabling the user to publish a social share. The user will also be taken through the sign-in process, if necessary.

parameterdescription.para: The Activity from which to show the sharing dialog
The activity you wish to share

memberdef.argsstring: (final Activity fromActivity, final JRActivityObject jrActivity, final Class<?extends JRCustomInterface > uiCustomization)

detaileddescription.para: Begin social publishing. The library will start a new Android Activity enabling the user to publish a social share. The user will also be taken through the sign-in process, if necessary.

parameterdescription.para: The Activity from which to show the sharing dialog
The activity you wish to share
The custom sign-in object to display in the provider list. May be null for no custom sign-in.

detaileddescription.para: Launch the beta direct share widget

parameterdescription.para: The Activity from which to show the sharing dialog
The activity you wish to share

memberdef.argsstring: (final JRActivityObject jrActivity, final FragmentActivity hostActivity, final int containerId, final boolean addToBackStack, final Integer transit, final Integer transitRes, final Integer customEnterAnimation, final Integer customExitAnimation)
memberdef.name: showSocialPublishingFragment

detaileddescription.para: Begin social publishing. The library will display a new Android Fragment enabling the user to publish a social share. The user will also be taken through the sign-in process, if necessary.

parameterdescription.para: The activity you wish to share
The android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity which will host the publishing fragment
The resource ID of a FrameLayout to embed the publishing fragment in
True if the publishing fragment should be added to the back stack, false otherwise
Select a standard transition animation for this transaction. See FragmentTransaction.setTransition. Null for not set
Set a custom style resource that will be used for resolving transit animations. Null for not set
Set a custom enter animation. May be null if-and-only-if customExitAnimation is also null
Set a custom exit animation. May be null if-and-only-if customEnterAnimation is also null

detaileddescription.para: Begin social publishing. The library will display a new Android Fragment enabling the user to publish a social share. The user will also be taken through the sign-in process, if necessary. This simple variant displays the Fragment, does not add it to the Fragment back stack, and uses default animations.

parameterdescription.para: The activity you wish to share
The android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity which will host the publishing fragment
The resource ID of a FrameLayout to embed the publishing fragment in

detaileddescription.para: Create a new android.support.v4.Fragment for social publishing. Use this if you wish to manage the FragmentTransaction yourself.

parameterdescription.para: The JRActivityObject to share, may not be null

simplesect.para: The created Fragment, or null upon error (caused by library configuration failure)

description.para: Methods that configure at runtime a subset of providers to use with the JREngage dialogs. These methods can only configure a subset of the configured and enabled providers found on your Engage application's dashboard.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the list of providers that are enabled for authentication. This does not supersede your RP's deplyoment settings for Android sign-in, as configured on rpxnow.com, it is a supplemental filter to that configuration.

parameterdescription.para: A list of providers which will be enabled. This set will be intersected with the set of providers configured on the Engage Dashboard, that intersection will be the providers that are actually available to the end-user.

detaileddescription.para:
Convenience variant of setEnabledAuthenticationProviders(List<String>)
enabledProviders
An array of providers which will be enabled. This set will be intersected with the set of providers configured on the Engage Dashboard, that intersection will be the providers that are actually available to the end-user.

Sets the list of providers that are enabled for social sharing. This does not supersede your RP's deplyoment settings for Android social sharing, as configured on rpxnow.com, it is a supplemental filter to that configuration.

parameterdescription.para: Which providers to enable for authentication, null for all providers. A list of social sharing providers which will be enabled. This set will be intersected with the set of providers configured on the Engage Dashboard, that intersection will be the providers that are actually available to the end-user.

detaileddescription.para:
Convenience variant of setEnabledSharingProviders(List<String>)
enabledSharingProviders
An array of social sharing providers which will be enabled. This set will be intersected with the set of providers configured on the Engage Dashboard, that intersection will be the providers that are actually available to the end-user.
If not set library logging is automatically controlled via the "debuggable" flag for the application set in AndroidManifest.xml

memberdef.argsstring: (Fragment fragment, FragmentActivity hostActivity, int containerId, boolean addToBackStack, Integer transit, Integer transitRes, Integer customEnterAnimation, Integer customExitAnimation)
memberdef.name: showFragment

detaileddescription.para: Begin social sign-in. The library will display a new Android Fragment enabling the user to sign in.

parameterdescription.para: The android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity which will host the publishing fragment
The resource ID of a FrameLayout to embed the publishing fragment in
True if the publishing fragment should be added to the back stack, false otherwise
Select a standard transition animation for this transaction. See FragmentTransaction.setTransition. Null for not set
Set a custom style resource that will be used for resolving transit animations. Null for not set
Set a custom enter animation. May be null if-and-only-if customExitAnimation is also null

Set a custom exit animation. May be null if-and-only-if customEnterAnimation is also null Begin social sign-in. The library will display a new Android Fragment enabling the user to sign in. This simple variant displays the Fragment, does not add it to the Fragment back stack, and uses default animations.
The android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity which will host the publishing fragment
The resource ID of a FrameLayout to embed the publishing fragment in Create a new android.support.v4.Fragment for social sign-in. Use this if you wish to manage the FragmentTransaction yourself.

simplesect.para: The created Fragment, or null upon error (caused by library configuration failure)

briefdescription.para: The JREngage class provides methods for configuring the Engage for Android library and initiating authentication and social sharing.

detaileddescription.para: Prior to using the Engage for Android library, you must already have an application on http://rpxnow.com. This is all that is required for authentication, although some providers require configuration (which can be done through your application's Dashboard). For social publishing, you will need to configure your Engage application with the desired providers.

You may optionally implement server-side authentication. When configured, the Engage for Android library can post the user's authentication token to a URL on your server: the token URL. Your server can complete authentication, access more of the Engage web API, log the authentication, etc. and the server's response will be passed back through to your Android application.

To use JREngage:
Call JREngage.initInstance
Save the returned JREngage object
Invoke showAuthenticationDialog() or showSocialPublishingDialog(JRActivityObject activity)
You may implement JREngageDelegate to receive responses
